TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Switch`1<T> extends System.Activities.NativeActivity
Public NotInheritable Class Switch(Of T) Inherits NativeActivity
generic <typename T> public ref class Switch sealed : System::Activities::NativeActivity

Docs.typeparam: The type of the values provided in the collection.
Docs.summary: Selects one choice from a number of activities to execute, based on the value of a given expression of the type specified in this object's type specifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each case in the <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch%601.Cases%2A> dictionary consists of a value (serving as the key for the dictionary) and an activity (serving as the value for the dictionary). The <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch`1.Expression%2A> is evaluated and compared against the keys in the <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch%601.Cases%2A> dictionary. If a match is found, the corresponding activity is executed. Every key in the <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch%601.Cases%2A> dictionary must be unique according to the dictionary's equality comparer.
## Examples The following code sample demonstrates creating a <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch%601> activity. This example is from the [Using Procedural Activities](~/docs/framework/windows-workflow-foundation/samples/using-procedural-activities.md) sample.
[!code-csharp[wfs_Procedurals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wfs_procedurals/cs/program.cs#1)]

Public ReadOnly Property Cases As IDictionary(Of T, Activity)
public: property System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<T, System::Activities::Activity ^> ^ Cases { System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<T, System::Activities::Activity ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Represents the dictionary of potential execution paths. Each entry contains a key and an activity that is executed when the result of the expression matches the key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the activity executes, the case that is executed is the first case whose key matches the <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch`1.Expression%2A> property.
## Examples The following code sample demonstrates setting the Cases property of a <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Switch%601> activity. This example is from the [Using Procedural Activities](~/docs/framework/windows-workflow-foundation/samples/using-procedural-activities.md) sample.
